skill.name: clinvar-database
skill.description: Query NCBI ClinVar for variant clinical significance. Search by gene/position, interpret pathogenicity classifications, access via E-utilities API or FTP, annotate VCFs, for genomic medicine.
skill.summary: Query NCBI ClinVar for variant clinical significance. Search by gene/position, interpret pathogenici...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files with examples for accessing NCBI's ClinVar database. All 241 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES triggered by code examples in documentation. The skill contains no executable code - only markdown documentation showing legitimate examples for querying a public genomic database. No actual security risks present.

content.value_statement: ClinVar contains critical variant classifications for clinical genetics, but accessing and interpreting this data requires specialized knowledge. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for querying ClinVar via web interface, API, or FTP downloads, with detailed interpretation guidelines for clinical significance classifications.
actual_capabilities: Search ClinVar by gene, condition, or clinical significance using web queries
Access E-utilities API for programmatic searches with rate limit guidance
Download bulk data via FTP in XML, VCF, or tab-delimited formats
Interpret ACMG/AMP clinical significance classifications (Pathogenic to Benign)
Understand review status star ratings for confidence assessment
Annotate VCF files with ClinVar classifications using bcftools
limitations: Requires understanding of genomic coordinates and HGVS notation
Cannot process variants greater than 10kb in VCF format
Rate limited to 3-10 requests per second depending on API key usage
Not for direct clinical diagnosis - requires genetics professional review

use_cases.title: Identify High-Confidence Pathogenic Variants
use_cases.description: Search for pathogenic variants in specific genes with expert panel review status for clinical reporting.

use_cases.title: Annotate VCF with Clinical Significance
use_cases.description: Download ClinVar VCF and annotate patient variant calls with clinical significance classifications.

use_cases.title: Analyze Disease-Associated Variants
use_cases.description: Study all variants associated with a specific condition and analyze their distribution across genes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Gene Search
prompt_templates.scenario: Find variants in a specific gene
prompt_templates.prompt: Search ClinVar for all variants in the BRCA1 gene and show me the pathogenic ones with high review status.

prompt_templates.title: Clinical Interpretation
prompt_templates.prompt: What does Uncertain Significance mean in ClinVar, and how should I interpret conflicting classifications?

prompt_templates.title: Bulk Data Download
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to download the latest ClinVar VCF file for GRCh38 and annotate my variants with it.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Query
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all likely pathogenic variants in CFTR that have been reviewed by expert panels, excluding conflicting interpretations.

output_examples.input: Find pathogenic BRCA1 variants with expert review
output: Found 127 pathogenic BRCA1 variants with three or four star review status
All variants confirmed by ClinGen expert panel or practice guidelines

best_practices: Always check review status (star rating) - prefer three or four star classifications
Document ClinVar version and access date for reproducibility
Test queries on web interface before automating with API
anti_patterns: Using VUS variants for clinical decisions without expert review
Ignoring conflicting interpretations without manual evaluation
Assuming classifications are permanent - they update with new evidence

faq.question: What is the difference between Pathogenic and Likely Pathogenic?
faq.answer: Pathogenic means approximately 99 percent probability of causing disease, while Likely Pathogenic is approximately 90 percent. Both are clinically actionable but with different confidence levels.

faq.question: How often is ClinVar updated?
faq.answer: The website updates weekly on Mondays, with monthly full releases on the first Thursday. Use monthly releases for reproducible research.

faq.question: Can I use ClinVar for direct patient diagnosis?
faq.answer: No, ClinVar is a research database. All clinical decisions require interpretation by a qualified genetics professional.

faq.question: What is the best format for bulk downloads?
faq.answer: XML files contain the most comprehensive data including all submissions and evidence. VCF files are best for genomic pipelines.

faq.question: How do I handle conflicting interpretations?
faq.answer: Check review status (prefer three or four star), examine evidence from each submitter, consider submission dates, and consult expert panels when available.

faq.question: Do I need an API key?
faq.answer: Not required but recommended. Without a key: 3 requests per second. With NCBI API key: 10 requests per second. Register at ncbi.nlm.nih.gov account.
